snippet.textDisplay: Is Midgar just a city now? No longer an upper plate and slums?  The kids seemed to be playing on the playground in the slums with that iconic slide, but it was clearly on the plate.

snippet.textDisplay: I bought myself the original Playstation for Christmas just so I could play Final Fantasy VII when it first came out.   And now, more than twenty years later, I bought a Playstation 4 for Christmas just so I could play this remake.   Well played Sony/SQUARE, well played.  My son will just have to entertain himself with the Xbox 360.  Mama needs her nostalgia.
snippet.textOriginal: I bought myself the original Playstation for Christmas just so I could play Final Fantasy VII when it first came out.   And now, more than twenty years later, I bought a Playstation 4 for Christmas just so I could play this remake.   Well played Sony/SQUARE, well played.  My son will just have to entertain himself with the Xbox 360.  Mama needs her nostalgia.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well, this is not like my own old special friend. Or maybe he went on to grow up after all the time. But he came with nothing else more. Something wrong happened to him, and he is not available as i wanted ever to be. He is not the same old friend that i've got before in my life. It's just like another person. Or maybe he grew up and changed a lot, and working on inside on a greedy corporation like Square Shinra Soft Inc.

Maybe this is not my lovely FFVII but who knows .....

snippet.textDisplay:
In 1997 I was 7 years old, Final Fantasy VII was one of my first games, it remains one of my favourites till this day.
It always reminds me about my childhood, when most things were carefree.
Thanks, Square Enix (Squaresoft/Square) for bringing this back.

Hope to see Xenogears, Vagrant Story, Chrono Trigger, Chrono Cross, Legend of Dragoon, Valkyrie Profile, Star Ocean: Second Story, Legend of Mana and Legend of Legaia at some point. At least remasters. I know some of them weren't made by Square, but maybe they can work things out.
snippet.textOriginal:
In 1997 I was 7 years old, Final Fantasy VII was one of my first games, it remains one of my favourites till this day.
It always reminds me about my childhood, when most things were carefree.
Thanks, Square Enix (Squaresoft/Square) for bringing this back.

Hope to see Xenogears, Vagrant Story, Chrono Trigger, Chrono Cross, Legend of Dragoon, Valkyrie Profile, Star Ocean: Second Story, Legend of Mana and Legend of Legaia at some point. At least remasters. I know some of them weren't made by Square, but maybe they can work things out.

snippet.textDisplay:
You know, I have listened a lot to the Distant World orchestrated soundtracks of Final Fantasy; I barely played any Final Fantasy game, but the moment I heard the music, it made me want to play it!
EDIT: and yes, I know a few things already... like beautiful foreshadowing in Aerith's theme!
snippet.textOriginal:
You know, I have listened a lot to the Distant World orchestrated soundtracks of Final Fantasy; I barely played any Final Fantasy game, but the moment I heard the music, it made me want to play it!
EDIT: and yes, I know a few things already... like beautiful foreshadowing in Aerith's theme!

snippet.textDisplay: 02:13 went straight into the bank
snippet.textOriginal: 02:13 went straight into the bank

snippet.textDisplay:
I almost cried. It's been so long... I still remember the first time I played it, my very first RPG... I was, what? 8? 9? I understood the mechanics way better than my elder brothers for some reason, who died on their first try against the scorpion.

But as I was watching I worried. "Isn't the ecologist themes a bit too overblown?". Then I remember: no, it was always like that, and I also realized that the ecologist message is right now, on 2020, more needed than ever. It's perfect, it couldn't be remade at a better time. I truly hope this game fares well, even if I cannot play it.
snippet.textOriginal:
I almost cried. It's been so long... I still remember the first time I played it, my very first RPG... I was, what? 8? 9? I understood the mechanics way better than my elder brothers for some reason, who died on their first try against the scorpion.

But as I was watching I worried. "Isn't the ecologist themes a bit too overblown?". Then I remember: no, it was always like that, and I also realized that the ecologist message is right now, on 2020, more needed than ever. It's perfect, it couldn't be remade at a better time. I truly hope this game fares well, even if I cannot play it.

snippet.textDisplay: Interesting.  I've played this game many times over the years, it never occurred to me that the low rez black texture on the world map around Midgar was supposed to be a barren desert wasteland, because the mako reactors were literally sucking the life out of the planet.
snippet.textOriginal: Interesting.  I've played this game many times over the years, it never occurred to me that the low rez black texture on the world map around Midgar was supposed to be a barren desert wasteland, because the mako reactors were literally sucking the life out of the planet.

snippet.textDisplay: Liked that they took away that pouty lipped deer in a headlights look he originally had when in the  games first trailer. Looks more real and relatable and not "Hey my weeaboos😘" Cloud simply just looks badass and anyone can stand behind that.Si✌️

snippet.textDisplay: So they're going to milk the game again on April 10th, 2021 with a PC/PS5/Xbox Series X release and call it the Definite Edition supporting 4K@60. The game looks quite impressive for 1080P atm and has surpassed Advent Children. I hope they will consider remastering a release of AC in 4K with updated textures.
snippet.textOriginal: So they're going to milk the game again on April 10th, 2021 with a PC/PS5/Xbox Series X release and call it the Definite Edition supporting 4K@60. The game looks quite impressive for 1080P atm and has surpassed Advent Children. I hope they will consider remastering a release of AC in 4K with updated textures.
